org.andengine.entity.sprite

Class ButtonSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.andengine.entity.Entity
      • org.andengine.entity.shape.Shape
        • org.andengine.entity.shape.RectangularShape
          • org.andengine.entity.sprite.Sprite
            • org.andengine.entity.sprite.TiledSprite
              • org.andengine.entity.sprite.ButtonSprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDrawHandler, IUpdateHandler, IEntity, ITouchArea, IAreaShape, IShape, IDisposable

    public class ButtonSprite
extends TiledSprite
    Note: ButtonSprite needs to be registered as a ITouchArea to the Scene via Scene.registerTouchArea(ITouchArea), otherwise it won't be clickable. To make ButtonSprite function properly, you should consider setting Scene.setTouchAreaBindingOnActionDownEnabled(boolean) to true. (c) Zynga 2012
    Since:
    15:51:57 - 05.01.2012
    Author:
    Scott Kennedy , Nicolas Gramlich

      • onAreaTouched

        public boolean onAreaTouched(TouchEvent pSceneTouchEvent,
                    float pTouchAreaLocalX,
                    float pTouchAreaLocalY)
        Description copied from interface: ITouchArea
        This method only fires if this ITouchArea is registered to the Scene via Scene.registerTouchArea(ITouchArea).
        Specified by:
        onAreaTouched in interface ITouchArea
        Overrides:
        onAreaTouched in class Shape
        Returns:
        true if the event was handled (that means IOnAreaTouchListener of the Scene will not be fired!), otherwise false.
